SENT.plain: The combination of Klippel-TrÃ©naunay-Weber syndrome (KTWS) with intracranial vascular malformations is documented by angiography in a 25 year old man with the classical features of KTWS: systematized naevi, hypertrophy of the right side, and varicosis
In addition, the syndrome was associated with "cuts laxa", a coincidence of somar rarity
The patient suffered from an ischaemic infarct of the brain stem with several neurological deficits
